td.content: s:a 40 yr old f interpreter presents with critical cough, critical shortness of breath, critical dyspnea and Respiratory for past 4 days. occasional EtOH she denies smoking o:Height 150 cm, Weight 92.1 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 89, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 15, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to pulmonary disease.

td.content: s:patient presents with critical cough, critical dyspnea, critical shortness of breath and Respiratory. she is having symptoms 11-13 x day, in spite of treatment. pt is a white female aged 40 years. she reports having no more than one drink a day Patient does not smoke o:Height 150 cm, Weight 92.9 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 89, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 16, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered Chest X-Ray.

td.content: s:a white female aged 42 years presents with 2 years history of critical cough, critical dyspnea, critical shortness of breath and Respiratory. she reports having no more than one drink a day denies any smoking o:Height 150 cm, Weight 91.8 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 16, FEV1 FEV1=35 %, FEV1/FVC FEV1/FVC=60 %, Arterial Blood Gas PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=58 mmHg, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:administered OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN via nasal cannula (contin), performed FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
